plan: For the first five rounds, I'll bid my exact value to gather baseline data. In rounds 6-10, I'll test aggressive bidding by adding a random increment (up to $10) to my value, which could lead to winning more often but at a higher cost. In rounds 11-15, I'll experiment with a conservative strategy by bidding slightly below my value (subtracting up to $5), to see if others overbid and I save costs. Throughout, I'll adjust based on the observed patterns of Betty and Charles, aiming to maximize profit by exploiting their bidding tendencies.

In the initial rounds, I'll test the dominant strategy by bidding my exact value to establish a baseline. Then, I'll explore aggressive overbidding when my value is high to increase potential profits, and underbidding slightly when my value is low to minimize losses. I'll also test randomizing bids within a small range of my value to gather data on opponents' behavior. By mid-game, I'll analyze patterns in Andy's and Charles's bids to adjust my strategy, potentially bluffing when I sense conservatism. I'll prioritize maximizing long-term profit by adapting based on observed outcomes and opponent tendencies.

In the next rounds, I'll test a mix of aggressive and conservative strategies. Initially, I'll bid slightly above my value to gather data on opponents' behavior. If opponents consistently bid their value, I'll match my bid to my value for optimal profit. In later rounds, I'll introduce variability by occasionally bidding below my value to test if opponents adjust their strategy. Additionally, if my value is high, I'll risk bidding closer to $99 to maximize profit potential. I'll continuously analyze previous rounds to refine my strategy and adapt to any discernible patterns in opponents' bidding.

Continue bidding exact value for five rounds to establish baseline. In rounds 6-10, add up to $10 to value for aggressive data-gathering. In rounds 11-15, bid up to $5 below value to test conservative strategy. Adapt based on Betty and Charles' patterns for profit maximization.

In the next rounds, I'll test overbidding slightly when my value is above 70 to increase win chances. For values below 50, I'll bid slightly under to reduce risks. I'll monitor opponents' bid patterns to adjust strategies, seeking optimal balance between aggression and caution for maximum profit.
